author: Special Correspondent
text:
Discusses security arrangements during electioneering and on polling day

Additional Director General of Police (Law and Order) J.K. Tripathy chaired a meeting held here on Saturday to review the law and order situation prevailing in the southern districts and instruct his subordinates the security arrangements to be ensured during the run-up for the poll and also on the date of election.

Tense affair

As electioneering and polling would usually be a tense affair in the southern districts, particularly in Tirunelveli and Thoothukudi districts, the district administrations, with inputs provided by the police, have identified ‘sensitive polling stations’ wherein Central Forces would be deployed along with the State police on the polling day.

To decide on the security arrangements to be made during electioneering and also in these polling stations on May 16, Mr. Tripathy had comprehensive discussions with his subordinates.

He reportedly told his colleagues to prepare a comprehensive list of anti-social elements, who could trigger law and order problems and unleash terror during election campaign and also on May 16 and flush them out in an unbiased manner.
title: ADGP reviews law and order situation in the south
